channel.title: math.GM updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GM updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: A proof of the Collatz conjecture
item.description: arXiv:2502.20642v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper, we show the new fixed point theorem in metric spaces. Furthermore, using this fixed point theorem, we show that the Collatz conjecture is true.
item.dc:creator: Toshiharu Kawasaki

item.title: On the sum of reciprocals of primes
item.description: arXiv:2403.04768v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Suppose that $y>0$, $0\leq\alpha<2\pi$ and $0<K<1$. Let $P^+$ be the set of primes $p$ such that $\cos(y\ln p+\alpha)>K$ and $P^-$ the set of primes $p$ such that $\cos(y\ln p+\alpha)<-K$ . In this paper we prove $\sum_{p\in P^+}\frac{1}{p}=\infty$ and $\sum_{p\in P^-}\frac{1}{p}=\infty$.
item.dc:creator: Young Deuk Kim

item.title: Investigation about a statement equivalent to Riemann Hypothesis (RH)
item.description: arXiv:2412.11130v5 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We try to approach a known equivalence to RH involving relative maxima and minima of Xi(t) on critical line by a representation of the derivative of the phase of Xi(s) with respect to imaginary coordinate that involves directly Euler product. In this attempt it is found an object conjectured to be the , almost everywhere, converging "spectrum" of prime numbers . Reasons and consequences of the conjecture are highlighted.
item.dc:creator: Giovanni Lodone
